evidence.text: EMTALA expressly preempts State laws “to the extent that the requirement directly conflicts with a requirement of this section.” 42 U.S.C. § 1395dd(f).
EMTALA expressly preempts State laws “to the extent that the requirement directly conflicts with a requirement of this section.” 42 U.S.C. § 1395dd(f).

See 42 U.S.C. § 1395cc. Hospitals submitting such agreements agree that they will “adopt and enforce a policy to ensure compliance with the requirements of [EMTALA] and to meet the requirements of [EMTALA].” Id. § 1395cc(a)(1)(I)(i).

See 42 U.S.C. § 1395cc. Hospitals submitting such agreements agree that they will “adopt and enforce a policy to ensure compliance with the requirements of [EMTALA] and to meet the requirements of [EMTALA].” Id. § 1395cc(a)(1)(I)(i).
Idaho Code § 18-622 violates the Supremacy Clause and is preempted to the extent it is contrary to EMTALA.
"The Supremacy Clause provides that … any Thing in the Constitution or Laws of any State to the Contrary notwithstanding."
